main event: Mr. and Mrs. R observed a bright light in the sky over Duluth, Minnesota, on December 6, 1967, which exhibited erratic movements and changed directions rapidly.
interesting points: The light was estimated to be larger than a normal aircraft light and remained visible for approximately 15 minutes., The light was described as very bright and self-illuminated., The witnesses were a former Air Force officer and his wife, providing them with experience in observing aircraft., They concluded that the object did not resemble any known type of aircraft or celestial object., A similar sighting occurred two evenings later where the observer saw the same type of light.
sighted object: a bright light in the sky
witness description: Mr. R, a former Air Force officer, and his wife
